results.title: The Tale of Ruby Rose
results.brief_description: Set amid the austere beauty of Tasmania’s mountainous landscape, The Tale of Ruby Rose is a portrait of a family alone in the wilderness and one woman’s strength to overcome an intense fear of the dark. Driven by her husband’s indifference to her fear, Ruby makes the hazardous trip across the mountains to the village of her birth in the lowlands. There, with her grandmother, she comes to terms with her terror of the elements. Cast: Melita Jurisic, Chris Haywood, Rod Zuanic, Martyn Sanderson, Sheila Florance.

results.title: The Tale of Peter Rabbit and Benjamin Bunny
results.creator_credit: Dennis Abey, Geoff Dunbar, Ginger Gibbons and Grand Slamm Partnership
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The World of Peter Rabbit and friends”.
Beatrix Potter’s beautifully illustrated books have long been a favourite with children. Her stories of the mischievous cousins, Peter Rabbit and Benjamin Bunny, come to life on the screen in this delightful animated adaptation. The video includes a live-action introduction dramatising Beatrix Potter and the animals that inspired her books.

results.title: The Taking of Pelham one two three
results.creator_credit: Palomar Pictures, Palladium Productions, Gabriel Katzka, Edgar J. Scherick and Joseph Sargent
results.brief_description: A thriller drama of the 70s about a well-planned train hijack of a New York City subway train, Pelham one two three (the name of the train’s starting station and its departure time, 1.23 pm). The highly organised armed gang of four is led by a British ex-mercenary who calls himself Mr Blue (Robert Shaw). Their demand is for $1 million in cash from the City of New York in exchange for 18 hostages contained in the first car which has been detached from the rest of the hijacked train. If their demand is not met within one hour, then one hostage will die for every minute the money is late. In the firing line is Lt Zachary Garber (Walter Matthau) of the Transit Authority Police who has the unenviable task of negotiating directly with Mr Blue and the heavy weight of the hostages’ lives in his hands. Panic and chaos ensue, and lives are lost, as frantic efforts are made to raise the cash. The plot has an interesting twist and the characters are made up of an eclectic mix. Based on the novel by John Gody with screenplay by Peter Stone, the film although full of suspense and drama laced with the odd moment of humour, unfortunately falls down when some of this humour involves racial slurring. Cast also includes Martin Balsam (Mr Green), Hector Elizondo (Mr Grey) and Earl Hindman (Mr Brown) and Lee Wallace (New York City Mayor).

results.title: The Tajik people: pottery making
results.creator_credit: Julien Bryan, International Film Foundation and Hermann Schlenker
results.brief_description: This film shows the potters of the village of Kulala, who are Tajik tribesmen in the Afghanistan mountains. Native music is used instead of English commentary or subtitles, and the film shows the preparation of the clay and the production of pots. These are traded and sold throughout Afghanistan.

results.title: The Tajik people: baking oven bread
results.creator_credit: International Film Foundation and Hermann Schlenker
results.brief_description: Shows how the Tajiks prepare their flat bread. Depicts a lone Moslem women kneading dough into a flattened round form and slapping it to the vertical walls of her clay oven. No narration. Suitable for school years prep-6.

results.title: The Tailor of Panama
results.brief_description: Set in 1999 Panama at the time of the handover of the canal to America, Geoffrey Rush plays Harry Pendel, an ex-con turned tailor to the towns elite. Harry meets Andrew Osnals (Pierce Brosnan), a British spy who convinces Harry to become his eyes and ears in regards to information on the political goings on in the area. What Andrew does not realise is that Harry is a master storyteller and not all that he claims to be, providing questionable information that is going to have dire consequences to all those involved in Harry’s web of deceit.

results.title: The Tailor from Torzhok
results.creator_credit: Mezhrabpom-Russ, Yakov Protazanov and Valentin Turkin
results.brief_description:
A simple tailor from a rural village unexpectedly strikes it rich in Leningrad in this fast paced satirical comedy which was commissioned to publicise the state lottery. Also available on 16mm.

Credits: Director, Yakov Protazanov ; script, V. Turkin ; photography, P. Yermolov.
Cast: L. Deikun, I. Ilyinsky.

results.title: The Tail
results.creator_credit: Yung Ting Lao and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT
results.brief_description:
Amusing 2-D and 3-D computer animated tale about tails and their eventual destination as trophies on a wall. No dialogue.
Graduate work from an AIM (Centre for Animation and Interactive Media) RMIT graduate, 2006.

results.title: The Ta Ching pioneers

results.title: The Symphony sound with Henry Lewis: introduction to the performing arts
results.creator_credit: Robert Saudek, Robert Saudek Associates, Learning Corporation of America and William Francisco
results.brief_description: Henry Lewis discusses the unique characteristics of the symphony orchestra, and describes the instruments and their particular roles within the symphony. Mr Lewis conducts the orchestra in examples from many periods and composers.
